page.title: 10OAKENCLOUGH:RECREATIONAL USE
page.content: The minor road through the area is very popular on fine sunny days in summer, known as the Harris End Fell Road,it is an excellent vantage point on a clear day,being about 170-200 metres above sea-level.Motorists park on the verges at the side of the unfenced road,from which there are splendid views of the Lake District Peaks,and over Morcombe Bay and Pilling Sands. For walkers,a favourite route has always been known as "Nicky Nook ", 215metres high,with a descent into the nearby valley,through the Rhododendrons and along Grize Dale. The description "an oasis in the hills" could be symbolic of an oasis of constancy in a world rapidly changing elsewhere.The character of the area has been deliberately conserved due to the nature of the interest of the 3 major landowner agencies.
